alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles; San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; San Miguel and Santa Rosa Islands; Santa Barbara County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County South Coast; Santa Cruz and Anacapa Islands; Ventura County Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 5:39AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR ALL COASTAL AREAS... * LOCAL IMPACTS... A tsunami capable of producing strong currents that may be hazardous to swimmers, boats, and coastal structures is expected. Widespread inundation is NOT expected. * RECOMMENDED ACTIONS... If you are located in this coastal area, move off the beach and out of harbors and marinas. Do not go to the coast to watch the tsunami. Be alert to instructions from your local emergency officials * FORECAST TSUNAMI START TIMES... Monterey California 0735 AM PST on Jan 15 Tsunamis often arrive as a series of waves or surges which could be dangerous for many hours after the first wave arrival. The first tsunami wave or surge may not be the highest in the series. * PRELIMINARY EARTHQUAKE INFORMATION... A occurred at 827 PM PST on Jan 14 2022, a large volcanic eruption occurred near the Tonga Islands. This product will be updated as new information becomes available. Stay tuned to your local news source and NOAA weather radio for further information and updates.
